Puiseux had attended courses by
Cauchy
early in his career and he soon became interested in research in the topics
Cauchy
was studying. He further developed
Cauchy
's work on functions of a complex variable, being the first to distinguish poles, essential points and branch points. He examined series expansions and looked at series with fractional powers. Although his work in this area was exceptionally good it became rather redundant after
Riemann
introduced the concept of a
Riemann
surface.
Laplace

We have already noted that Puiseux was a keen mountaineer but we should record that he was the first to scale an Alpine peak which is now named after him. He continued climbing, often with his sons, until
1879

14

28

Without meddling with anything, he meditated on everything. His mind resembled one of those powerful machines which, without straining or restraining itself, silently triumphed over any obstacle.
